StPaulTim said:

BWPanda - What do you use to make your screencasts? Example: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4432#issuecomment-703331456

OBS will record to avi then a quick avi to gif converter, plenty online options, and OBS works on Linux and Mac as well.

For those of you familiar with OBS. Do I understand correctly that it's not really an video editing tool? I record with OBS, but then edit with something else?

Looking for Linux recommendations.

About to try Blender.
This topic was moved here from #Backdrop > Screencasts by StPaulTim
OK, I looked at the Blender UI and I'm now hiding under my bed.
5 Minutes with this https://kdenlive.org/en/download/ and I feel much better. Looks much more like video editing software I've used before.
Yeah, as far as I know, Blender is for creating 3D digital objects for use in animation, etc. And yes, Kdenlive is a good, simple video editor.
@StPaulTim Thank You for the tip. I will use the Kdenlive for editing in the future. :+1:

Yes... you and no... it all depends what you are doing with it lol...

You can create a video (Edit) on the fly while it's being recorded... and / or edit it in a video editing software.

OBS was originally created for live game capture and then streaming the gameplay live to Twitch (among other streaming platforms)... but it's so flexible... I use it for a Live (BC - before Covid) soccer big screen TV to play adverts and goal replays etc...

I also use it for webinars, and Zoom meetings.

Hi, as I'm a fulltime linux user too, the problem of video editing has bothered me from the beginning. Linux doesn't have a good video editor for professional use. The last editor I discovered and so far am pretty happy with it is "olive video editor". It's still in alpha but stable enough. I have version 0.1 (April 2019 | Alpha | 1e3cf53) which is stable. I tried the most recent version 0.2 but was unstable.
